availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant. Pennsylvania, native. Married to Hannah Gill. Father of George W. Gill, Charles A. Gill, Samuel G. Gill, and Sarah Gill. Store owner in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Jefferson County in 1850. Lumber merchant in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Jefferson County in 1860. Member of the Subsistence Committee in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 7, p. 355A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/District 4, p. 65.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 7, p. 484.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 7, p. 4.
"Meeting of the Subsistence Committee," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), October 3, 1861, p. 3.
